SENT.plain: A 77-year-old woman with myelodysplastic syndrome required platelet transfusion

However, she complained of facial flushing and dyspnea immediately after the initiation of an infusion of platelet concentrations (PC) utilizing a Pall PL-PXL8H filter with a negatively charged surface
The same symptoms recurred following a transfusion of washed PC with saline
However, an infusion utilizing a Sepacell PLX5A-W with a positively charged surface caused no problems
Furthermore, the patient demonstrated the same adverse reaction after administration of prostaglandin F2 alpha
This case suggested that special caution is warranted when patients who have an allergic history receive PC infusions through leukocyte-reduction filters with negatively charged surfaces
